In the example:

class Child(Model):

Child.parent is a ForwardManyToOneDescriptor instance.

class radiofeed.episodes.models.Episode(id, podcast, guid, pub_date, title, description, keywords, link, episode_type, episode, season, cover_url, media_url, media_type, length, duration, explicit, search_vector)¶

Bases: Model

exception DoesNotExist¶

exception MultipleObjectsReturned¶

Bases: MultipleObjectsReturned

audiolog_set¶

Accessor to the related objects manager on the reverse side of a many-to-one relation.

In the example:

class Child(Model):
    parent = ForeignKey(Parent, related_name='children')

Parent.children is a ReverseManyToOneDescriptor instance.

Most of the implementation is delegated to a dynamically defined manager class built by create_forward_many_to_many_manager() defined below.

bookmark_set¶

Accessor to the related objects manager on the reverse side of a many-to-one relation.

In the example:

class Child(Model):
    parent = ForeignKey(Parent, related_name='children')

Parent.children is a ReverseManyToOneDescriptor instance.

Most of the implementation is delegated to a dynamically defined manager class built by create_forward_many_to_many_manager() defined below.

radiofeed.episodes.views module¶

radiofeed.episodes.views.add_bookmark(request, episode_id)¶

Add episode to bookmarks.

Parameters:

  • request (HttpRequest) –

  • episode_id (int) – Episode PK

Returns:

returns HTMX snippet containing subscribe button. Returns HTTP CONFLICT

if episode already bookmarked.

Return type:

HttpResponse

Raises:

Http404 – episode not found

radiofeed.episodes.views.bookmark_action_response(request, episode, is_bookmarked)¶

request (HttpRequest) –

Returns:

returns empty response if player not running.

HttpResponse

Raises:

Http404 – episode not found

radiofeed.episodes.views.index(request, since=datetime.timedelta(days=14))¶

List latest episodes from subscriptions if any, else latest episodes from promoted podcasts.

Parameters:

  • request (HttpRequest) –

  • since (timedelta) – only include podcasts with last pub date since this time

Returns:

TemplateResponse

radiofeed.episodes.views.player_response(request, episode: Episode, *, start_player, current_time, listened)¶

Renders player inside HTMX snippet.

Parameters:

  • request (HttpRequest) –

  • episode (Episode) –

  • start_player (bool) – render the player and start play in client

  • current_time (datetime | None) – current time played so far

  • listened (datetime | None) – time when last listened to episode

Returns:

TemplateResponse

radiofeed.episodes.views.player_time_update(request)¶

Update current play time of episode. Time should be passed in POST as current_time integer value.

Parameters:

request (HttpRequest) –

Returns:

HTTP BAD REQUEST if missing/invalid current_time, otherwise

HTTP NO CONTENT.

Return type:

HttpResponse
